thread.title: NC residents invited to bring home movies to State Archives
thread.title_full: NC residents invited to bring home movies to State Archives

author: The Associated Press
title: NC residents invited to bring home movies to State Archives
text:
NC residents invited to bring home movies to State Archives The Associated Press Order Reprint of this Story RALEIGH, N.C. 
North Carolina residents can bring their home movies to the State Archives auditorium and watch them on the big screen. 
Officials with the state Department of Natural and Cultural Resources say Home Movie Day will be held Saturday afternoon in Raleigh. People can bring film in any format for inspection, discussion and on-site projection. Depending on the film's condition, participants can view their film on the big screen and discuss it. 
A/V Geeks Transfer Service will provide equipment so that participants can transfer their film for free. 
Home Movie Day is an international event being held in communities around the world. Film archivists will tell people how to care for their film and videotape. Related content
